title.rendered: When work hits close to home

content.rendered:
Innovation

When work hits close to home

For Chris Hinson, one of our colleagues, Merck’s commitment to making our medicines available to patients is very personal

February 2, 2021

Share this article

In November 2016, two weeks before Thanksgiving, Christopher (Chris) Hinson, Employee Health and Safety Lead at our Durham manufacturing facility, learned that his father, Robert Hinson, was diagnosed with cancer and needed a medicine that is made in Chris’ plant.

“Working for a pharmaceutical company that supplies medicines for so many people around the world should be a great feeling for any employee.  For me, working for the company that makes a medicine that my dad took is almost indescribable,” said Chris. 

“I am proud to be a Merck employee, I am humbled to work in Durham, and I am honored to be the EHS Lead as we work to increase our production of this important product. Sometimes, being a part of something might just become more special than you ever imagined.”

Chris Hinson

Employee Health and Safety Lead

Your voice is important

Your experience matters

Clinical trials

Learn more about our clinical trial programs

What is a clinical trial?

A clinical trial is a research study in human volunteers that helps determine whether investigational vaccines, medicines, or new uses for existing vaccines and medicines are safe and work well.

Medical advances can only happen through the efforts of many people, especially the patients who volunteer for clinical trials. They are our partners in research.
